title: 820-00165 no PP5V_S4RS3 and PP3V3_SUS
message:
I'm working on 820-00165 board, which came to me with description: "Turned off by itself, after a while turned on, but SSD wasn't detected. Now has no reaction for charger". 

My observations:

- board is clean, no corrosion, no water damage, no mechanical damage.
- there is no green light when charger plugged in
- I have discovered, that PP3V42_G3H is missing and has  low reading - 0,007V to ground in diode mode. After further inspection I found out, that short is caused by SMC itself. I have removed SMC and replaced it with one from the same board. PP3V42_G3H is back now, I have green then orange light on charger, but no fan spin. 

Other measurements: 

- PPBUS_G3H - 8,57V
- PP3V42_G3H - 3,42V
- PP3V3_S5 - 3,35V
- PP5V_S5 - 5,12V
- PPVRTC_G3H - 3,31V
- [B]PP5V_S4RS3 - 0V (0,390V to ground)[/B]
-[B] PP3V3_SUS - 0V (0,390V to ground)
 -PP3V3_SUS_EN - 0V (0,495V to ground)
- PM_SLP_SUS_L - 0V [B](not pulsing)[/B]
- PM_SLP_S4_L - 0V (not pulsing)[/B]

I already have tried another SMC from 820-00165 board, but it behaves the same.

title: 820-00165 no PP5V_S4RS3 and PP3V3_SUS
message:
PCH must first release PM_SLP_SUS_L.
It expects PM_DSW_PWRGD, PCH_DSWVRMEN, SMC_ADAPTER_EN, PM_BATLOW_L and good RTC signals.

title: 820-00165 no PP5V_S4RS3 and PP3V3_SUS
message:
These are reading for lines you mentioned:

PM_DSW_PWRGD is 3,42V
PCH_DSWVRMEN is 3,22V
SMC_ADAPTER_EN is 3,42V
PM_BATLOW_L is 3,22V

RTC signals: 

PCH_CLK32K_RTCX is 0,441V
PCH_INTRUDER_L is 2,35V
PCH_INTVRMEN is 3,22V
PCH_SRTCRST_L is 3,3V
RTC_RESET_L is 3,3V

title: 820-00165 no PP5V_S4RS3 and PP3V3_SUS
message:
Looks like bad PCH.
It has all required signals, but doesn't want to release PM_SLP_SUS_L.
Maybe overvoltage on 3V42_G3H power rail affected PCH too.

title: 820-00165 no PP5V_S4RS3 and PP3V3_SUS
message: For me it sounds a bit strange, that it could kill PCH.. Is it worth to try changing bios? Or in this state it's pointless?

title: 820-00165 no PP5V_S4RS3 and PP3V3_SUS
message: Yes, I know that. Just thought, that my multimeter is too slow to catch short pulse on this line and bad bios cause PCH to cut it off.

title: 820-00165 no PP5V_S4RS3 and PP3V3_SUS
message:
BIOS chip (U6100) requires 3V power.
It doesn't play anything until 3V3_SUS appears...

Heat PCH with quality flux and pray.
